DataElement.preferredName: FACT-Cognitive Questionnaire Problem Remembering Items Placement Score Frequency 5 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric response to a questionnaire item asking about if an individual has had trouble remembering where things were put.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-Cognitive Questionnaire Problem Remembering Items Placement Frequency Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cognitive; of or being or relating to or involving cognition._A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G._Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient._A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._The power of retaining and recalling past experience, something that is remembered._Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cognitive; of or being or relating to or involving cognition.:A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.

Concepts.definition: Of or being or relating to or involving cognition.

A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.

The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.

A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
